question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Dr. Jones lives in a country with a progressive tax system. That is, he does not pay any taxes on the first $\$20{,}000$ in income he makes, he pays $5\%$ taxes on the next $\$25{,}000$, he pays $10\%$ taxes on the next $\$35{,}000$, he pays $15\%$ on the next $\$50{,}000$, and he pays $20\%$ on every additional dollar onwards. If Dr. Jones pays $\$10{,}000$ in taxes, then how much income does he make?
inference:
Solution: 
Let $x$ be the total income of Dr. Jones. 
The first $\$20{,}000$ is tax-free.
Then, on the next $\$25{,}000$, he pays $5\%$ taxes, so that's $\$25{,}000 \cdot 0.05 = \$1{,}250$
On the next $\$35{,}000$, he pays $10\%$ taxes, so that's $\$35{,}000 \cdot 0.10 = \$3{,}500$
On the next $\$50{,}000$, he pays $15\%$ taxes, so that's $\$50{,}000 \cdot 0.15 = \$7{,}500$
Now, to pay $\$10{,}000$ in total, he needs to pay an additional $\$10{,}000 - \$1{,}250 - \$3{,}500 - \$7{,}500 = \$1{,}750$ in taxes.
This additional tax is paid on the income he makes above $\$20{,}000 + \$25{,}000 + \$35{,}000 + \$50{,}000 = \$130{,}000$, so he makes $\$1{,}750 / 0.20 = \$8{,}750$ on top of that.
So, his total income is $\$130{,}000 + \$8{,}750 = \$138{,}750$.

Final Answer: \\boxed{\$138{,}750}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
If Dr. Jones has an income of $x$, then the amount of tax is essentially a piecewise function in $x$. In particular, if we let $t(x)$ denote the amount of taxes, then $t(x) = 0$ when $0 \le x \le 20000$. For $20000 \le x \le 45000$, he pays $$t(x) = 0.05 (x-20000).$$For $45000 \le x \le 80000$, he pays  \begin{align*}
t(x)& = 0.05(45000-20000) + 0.1(x - 45000)\\
& = 1250 + x/10 - 4500.
\end{align*}For $80000 \le x \le 130000$ he pays  \begin{align*}
t(x) &= 1250 + 0.1(80000-45000) + 0.15(x - 80000)\\
& = 4750 + 0.15x - 12000.
\end{align*}Finally, if $x \ge 130000$, he pays  \begin{align*}t(x) &= 4750 + 0.15(130000-80000) + 0.2(x - 130000)\\
& = 12250 + 0.2(x - 130000).\end{align*}We can immediately eliminate the last possibility, since then he would automatically pay at least $\$12,250$ in taxes. If $x \le 80000$, then $t(x) \le 1250 + 80000/10 - 4500 = 4750$. Hence, $80000 \le x \le 130000$. Then, $$10000 = 4750 + 0.15x - 12000 \Longrightarrow x = \boxed{\$115,000}.$$

The first $\$20{,}000$ is tax-free.
Then, on the next $\$25{,}000$, he pays $5\%$ taxes, so that's $\$25{,}000 \cdot 0.05 = \$1{,}250$
On the next $\$35{,}000$, he pays $10\%$ taxes, so that's $\$35{,}000 \cdot 0.10 = \$3{,}500$
On the next $\$50{,}000$, he pays $15\%$ taxes, so that's $\$50{,}000 \cdot 0.15 = \$7{,}500$
Now, to pay $\$10{,}000$ in total, he needs to pay an additional $\$10{,}000 - \$1{,}250 - \$3{,}500 - \$7{,}500 = \$1{,}750$ in taxes.
This additional tax is paid on the income he makes above $\$20{,}000 + \$25{,}000 + \$35{,}000 + \$50{,}000 = \$130{,}000$, so he makes $\$1{,}750 / 0.20 = \$8{,}750$ on top of that.
So, his total income is $\$130{,}000 + \$8{,}750 = \$138{,}750$.

Final Answer: \\boxed{\$138{,}750}. I hope it is correct.

ground_truth:
If Dr. Jones has an income of $x$, then the amount of tax is essentially a piecewise function in $x$. In particular, if we let $t(x)$ denote the amount of taxes, then $t(x) = 0$ when $0 \le x \le 20000$. For $20000 \le x \le 45000$, he pays $$t(x) = 0.05 (x-20000).$$For $45000 \le x \le 80000$, he pays  \begin{align*}
t(x)& = 0.05(45000-20000) + 0.1(x - 45000)\\
& = 1250 + x/10 - 4500.
\end{align*}For $80000 \le x \le 130000$ he pays  \begin{align*}
t(x) &= 1250 + 0.1(80000-45000) + 0.15(x - 80000)\\
& = 4750 + 0.15x - 12000.
\end{align*}Finally, if $x \ge 130000$, he pays  \begin{align*}t(x) &= 4750 + 0.15(130000-80000) + 0.2(x - 130000)\\
& = 12250 + 0.2(x - 130000).\end{align*}We can immediately eliminate the last possibility, since then he would automatically pay at least $\$12,250$ in taxes. If $x \le 80000$, then $t(x) \le 1250 + 80000/10 - 4500 = 4750$. Hence, $80000 \le x \le 130000$. Then, $$10000 = 4750 + 0.15x - 12000 \Longrightarrow x = \boxed{\$115,000}.$$
